intro: Tidestromia lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is known for its fuzzy, hairy leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Tidestromia lanuginosa is an important plant for pollinators and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
